column2: Keynote - Still no flying cars, but at least we get rollups
column13: Dankrad Feist is an Ethereum researcher with a background in Theoretical Physics and Technology. Since joining the Ethereum Foundation in 2019, he has worked on topics that involve applied cryptography, such as sharding, statelessness, the proof of custody and other topics.

Bartek Kiepuszewski is a Blockchain Researcher working for MakerDAO Protocol Engineering team where he is primarily responsible for risk assessment  of various scaling solutions for Ethereum. He is also a co-founder of l2beat.com, the community-focused, vendor-neutral portal educating users about Ethereum Layer2 ecosystem.

column10: Anthony Sassano, Ed Felten, Ben Jones, Ohad Barta, Alex Gluchowski
column13: Independent Ethereum educator, angel investor and advisor. Anthony is a founder of The Daily Gwei and a Co-Founder of EthHub.
column16: Ed Felten is Co-founder and Chief Scientist at Offchain Labs, the makers of Arbitrum. He was previously the Kahn Professor of Computer Science and Public Affairs at Princeton University, and served on the White House staff as Deputy United States Chief Technology Officer. He is a member of the U.S. National Academy of Engineering and a Fellow of the ACM.
column19: Ben "Weird ETH Yankovic" Jones is a co-founder and Chief Scientist at Optimism. Prior to Optimism he worked on Ethereum's CBC Casper team.  In his free time he works on crypto music.
column22: Ohad Barta has been a product manager at StarkWare for two years. He is involved in numerous projects building on both StarkNet and StarkEx. Ohad came to StarkWare with 9 years of prior experience in theoretical cryptography and code development.
column25: Alex is a software architect with over 15 years of experience in engineering and startups. Currently, he is a co-founder at Matter Labs, an R&D company on a mission to solve blockchain scalability challenge with zero-knowledge proofs. Alex is deeply passionate about individual freedom, self-ownership and decentralization.

column13: Ohad Barta has been a product manager at StarkWare for two years. He is involved in numerous projects building on both StarkNet and StarkEx. Ohad came to StarkWare with 9 years of prior experience in theoretical cryptography and code development.

column2: Induced Demand from Blockchain Resource Pricing
column13: John is a PhD dropout (for real) and co-founder of Celestia Labs and Fuel Labs. Previously, he was a scalability researcher at ConsenSys, where he created the optimistic rollup design paradigm.

column2: Internals of Matter Lab's zkEVM - design goals, technical challenges and tricks
column13: Ethereum enthusiast, Co-founder of Matter Labs.

column2: Hybrid Compute: Realizing the Full Potential of Web3
column13: Alan is Founder and CEO of Boba Network. He has more than 20 years of company building and investing experience, with a background in distributed systems, enterprise software, and fintech. Alan serves on the Stanford Graduate School of Business Alumni Board, as well as the board of Stanford Angels and Entrepreneurs as Co-President.

column2: Fire the Cannons: Optimism's Next-Gen Fault Proofs
column13: Ben "Weird ETH Yankovic" Jones is a co-founder and Chief Scientist at Optimism. Prior to Optimism he worked on Ethereum's CBC Casper team.  In his free time he works on crypto music.

A visionary and transformative leader, with a hybrid skill set of technology and business. Yuan received his Bachelor of Computer Science with Honors at Acadia University and his Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.), Corporate Strategy, and Leadership at the University of Toronto. Quickly ascended the ranks to become Technical & Engagement Lead at IBM Canada, and moved on to become Co-Founder & Tech Lead at Metis.

column2: Cross chain operations made easy with OpenZeppelin
column13: Hadrien is French, has a Ph.D. in computer science from the École Normale Supérieure de Lyon, and has been working as a smart-contracts engineer since 2017. Currently he is a part of the OpenZeppelin development team, working on the open-source smart-contracts library and the associated tooling.
